title: Engineering & Technology Education (2023-24): Exploration of Communications Technology (8600030)
subject: CTE

document.title: CTE Curriculum Framework - Middle School Courses - Engineering and Technology Education - Integrated Technology Studies

B2197DABF0554CF8A828B35790993951.description: Generate a product using optical technology.

694E06F1270F428BB26B891C68FA899D.description: Explain how light signals are transmitted and received via different optical devices to include but not limited to: fiber optics, satellite communication, bandwidth, laser, and photography.

ABB2F270880A45288FDEA8C549453235.description: Identify the purposes and property of light as used in communication technology.

A009CFE0DDA849CDB0ACD8CDBC82CC62.description: Identify and demonstrate the role of optical technology.--The student will be able to:

36C69FC0D7FF4F0E89C92C0D0FBDA64C.description: Produce an audio and/or visual product using electronic communication technology.

306EE9BEF618417282DF397CB2C8D0E3.description: Utilize a telecommunications device to transmit and receive an electronic message.

FBADA278E2AB46E7B480094ADED297B2.description: Define and explain the use of telecommunications in everyday life.

A02D2592C8C64117ADE7EE62763FF24D.description: List and explain the common communication categories.

DEBC90CBF42C467AAC94702E8C4F44B5.description: Explain how to create code, transmit, and receive messages using electronic devices.

EF87B191E96948B09CCA581FD5A20B88.description: Identify and demonstrate the role of electronic communication.--The student will be able to:

CB4CBD01B090427688C780AAF401BE87.description: Utilize appropriate finishing techniques on a printed project.

9BADC0123940477FA45A619CE8675CEA.description: Produce a printed product using a current printing method.

92D2AABAFF3A461690AC1DDE4123C1B6.description: Utilize common design principles to create camera ready art.

1908B178ECD4456396D93149FB30DB07.description: Identify and explain standard printing processes including but not limited to: relief, gravure, screen process, and lithographic printing.

DF18334481724A10A99903521F65487C.description: Identify and describe the major types of printing techniques used in print production.--The student will be able to:

CE0FB10AD9794371827ABAAA77B1F472.description: Create a document on a digital publishing system by inputting existing digitized graphics or by digitizing original art or photographs on a digitizing scanner.

FA9A16DCEB4A423A8373B152BFFFCFF9.description: Develop a web page using appropriate digital software.

8A477D3681F947EE84863B267F9C4C0D.description: Utilize the components of layouts including type, typography and illustration to digitally manipulate the elements of a published product.

E999401CE25746BD95B1789B8B4CBDE2.description: Utilize digital publishing to combine input, editing, and output into a finished product.

893271D0B9C14CC6BD2A0F79969B0BF5.description: Demonstrate an application of basic digital publishing techniques.--The student will be able to:

7F82F518170A44CD883DDE11502704CA.description: List academic and career programs at the secondary levels in communication technology.

8C83508C482F42679FCCFF765439D96B.description: List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in communication technology.

05E9454A57B34E99BEE27AA8A6DD8D41.description: Discuss individual interests related to a career.

DF23197DFEE042AC880653D14D05912C.description: Discuss individual interests and aptitudes as they relate to a career.--The student will be able to:

3539CDB7BC9E4100BD935FE6D1BD9B57.description: Perform roles in a student personnel system or in a career and technical student organization (CTSO).

994BABE470D54F5B8C4F7FAC04B0F37B.description: Exhibit positive human relations and leadership skills.--The student will be able to:

B3920F5783A94EC28878DF3BA6C7BECF.description: Identify harmful effects/potential dangers of familiar hazardous substances/devices to people and the environment.

DC4AB412828445389703011D5123A140.description: Explain fire prevention and safety precautions and practices for extinguishing fires.

DF856393DEBD4529A3B46A0018F4133C.description: Safely use hand tools and power equipment.

B9E7AEAFBB2D4FDE94DD6788AB7A82CF.description: Select appropriate tools, machines, and equipment to accomplish a given task.

7800FEB4576049B78E7D66947062D006.description: Exercise care and respect for all tools, equipment, and materials.

0BEA730B1D104F86838D15B1CF794A03.description: Conduct classroom/laboratory activities and equipment operations in a safe manner.

2AB9A719A239478E8E0260A6C72DCD05.description: Demonstrate good housekeeping at workstations within a classroom/laboratory.

02FB6C65BF344E7BA34A7CB4C2EF1C3E.description: Follow classroom/laboratory safety rules and procedures.

8DA965CC45FB45B2955D3D49E0901088.description: Demonstrate proper and safe procedures while working with technological tools, apparatus, equipment, systems, and materials.--The student will be able to:

9D2D63A01D0D4B94A8A55F54EE1F163C.description: Use symbols, measurements, and drawings to promote clear communication by providing a common language to express ideas.

905E159F78334C9FBEA67ED6D25C6C43.description: Consider factors that influence the design of a message, such as the intended audience, medium, purpose, and nature of the message.

B6CC6B367491404A943F1AB600B543F5.description: Create information and communication that allow information to be transferred from human to human, human to machine, machine to machine, and machine to human.

A25132B21029413B85C1C5C54408CF38.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and be able to select and use information and communication technologies.--The student will be able to:

F7F9284A5AE34ECE97CF241305E2D7BD.description: Interpret and evaluate the accuracy of the information obtained and determine if it is useful.

A5AFC8C2830846E0936CC43D46AD0B49.description: Identify trends and monitor potential consequences of technological development.

6C887B928B5540D29505A7ECBB40E432.description: Use data collected to analyze and interpret trends in order to identify the positive or negative effects of a technology.

75267C0DA5194E569C15F9951473D12C.description: Design and use instruments to gather data.

8A21A276F7BD469B8B45473842C7AE5E.description: Demonstrate the abilities to assess the impact of products and systems.--The student will be able to:

4DA867B010A3403D8D93848E12806286.description: Operate and maintain systems in order to achieve a given purpose.

0AD0E6F82491426AB9B8AE7DD27CA451.description: Use computers and calculators in various applications.

E04BF367CDDC4F08B4421C6BF0B72FA1.description: Use tools, materials, and machines safely to diagnose, adjust, and repair systems.

907C5B0D64B54966916380E2D546F1AF.description: Use information provided in manuals, protocols, or by experienced people to see and understand how things work.

2AFF89F8747B451E8373431DCB4653B4.description: Demonstrate the abilities to use and maintain technological products and systems.--The student will be able to:

ABF5EAC56D1349AE9E13E8C3D5551A50.description: Make a product or system and document the solution.

9C5450CB37EA4E65A127C3854E344977.description: Test and evaluate the design in relation to pre-established requirements, such as criteria and constraints, and refine as needed.

6B6C2890936F45F08105FBDE03D4421D.description: Make two-dimensional and three-dimensional representations of the designed solution.

E6D3199FC66A46DABB308EEA4F8C297C.description: Specify criteria and constraints for the design.

0E5054049C6A49B999A9829485E47D31.description: Apply a design process to solve problems in and beyond the laboratory-classroom.

A56AEC0B493342F89C6E1B57C4F5E99A.description: Demonstrate the abilities to apply the design process.--The student will be able to:

9260A11D01594DA598B1A2CCCD9D5CDD.description: Identify technological problems that are best solved through experimentation.

840AA73897E8420A83F66E7711A91EC0.description: Describe invention as a process of turning ideas and imagination into devices and systems and innovation as the process of modifying an existing product or system to improve it.

A7F38F82010C423082C92BC620D10292.description: Use troubleshooting as a problem-solving method used to identify the cause of a malfunction in a technological system.

6A557A752F55404B9BBC1D0DAE27DE3E.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of troubleshooting, research and development, invention and innovation, and experimentation in problem solving.--The student will be able to:

D700F8088F1F4C7F9814105DBC8FDF10.description: Model, test, evaluate and modify designs to transform ideas into practical solutions.

747E007238374A6FB3D0803354402FF9.description: Employ brainstorming as a group problem-solving design process in which each person in the group presents his or her ideas in an open forum.

4BB084C529864421BCDE2FD6351BBD52.description: Utilize the design process involving a set of steps, which can be performed in different sequences and repeated as needed.

B5C6B5FDB8FA42FCB114FA7C487FE3AB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of engineering design.--The student will be able to:

C95C177F95AF4A99AB56FAAB90B1AEBF.description: Evaluate criteria and constraints that are requirements for a design.

804E0A4A433C4FF2B7D4226DC9896ACD.description: Explain why there is no perfect design.

DF69DFEE52404A1988B9281EBAEFA229.description: Use design as a creative planning process that leads to useful products and systems.

004308F3E64741F8B1D277E75484AF20.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the attributes of design.--The student will be able to:

475CD17BE72B4F43A9E46E77BEB50177.description: Explain that in the past, an invention or innovation was not usually developed with the knowledge of science.

E539A85832B742DFA29D825A4D235463.description: Explain how the specialization of function has been at the heart of many technological improvements.

81BAB6B8BACF422FBF0ACD2E644C3324.description: Describe inventions and innovations that have evolved by using slow and methodical processes of tests and refinements.

51FA960A46BB40A2B40F0EC395A611AB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the influence of technology on history.--The student will be able to:

B41FAA06D1724F078BB6D472BB17AEE0.description: Explain how meeting societal expectations is the driving force behind the acceptance and use of products and systems.

3769791B966642688F590CCA88FF7C45.description: Describe social and cultural priorities and values that are reflected in technological devices.

9B3D50810F2241AE9A18AF2D58197BC0.description: Describe changes in society and the creation of new needs and wants caused by the use of inventions and innovations.

3A225FD1B288410CA133B5411E99E82D.description: Describe the development of technologies that has resulted from the demands, values, and interests of individuals, businesses, industries, and societies.

D65D982C12EB498482A1AFBB7C893B68.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of society in the development and use of technology.--The student will be able to:

C5A7EFC4FA5B4FBB8F0CEEDCBEDC877A.description: Make decisions about the development and use of communication technologies that put environmental and economic concerns in direct competition with one another.

7A5C79DB8F1B4FCD9577A43FE88C476C.description: Identify how communication technologies can be affected by natural disaster.

3EC0749FA182473DA6ACF77D299D278B.description: Describe the management of waste produced by communication technological systems as an important societal issue.

471F6ADA37B14742A949E0488107B5FD.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the effects of technology on the environment.--The student will be able to:

6D04D9BB29324440915C7052C1EDAB0E.description: Describe the economic, political, and cultural issues that are influenced by the development and use of communication technology.

10E21EF1FFE14234AC772C2B4C9838BF.description: Describe ethical issues associated with the development and use of communication technology.

9E4CF39F945C465E9091E8562575B725.description: Explain that communication technology, by itself, is neither good nor bad; but decisions about the use of products and systems can result in desirable or undesirable consequences.

C4105EACBFD74010B79BABA9AD68C1EA.description: Describe the ways that the use of communication technologies affects humans, including their safety, comfort, choices, and attitudes.

68639AFF87C24A278046F5623E8ECB67.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the cultural, social, economic, and political effects of technology.--The student will be able to:

559C3374575D4DBF9B40BC1134971C7B.description: Explain how knowledge gained from other fields of study has a direct effect on the development of technological products and systems.

5911BD1F76274B4B8BF6E8A8D8150C32.description: Apply a product, system, or environment developed for one setting in another setting.

043777FA06774C1F992404E9B3A24912.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships among technologies and the connection between technology and other fields of study.--The student will be able to:

F74D5E9C1BD54FA681AA97ADA38BB324.description: Apply systems thinking, involving considering how every part relates to others.

BDA865F49B084E7F8A6827FB0541D5C8.description: Identify technological systems including input, processes, output, and, at times, feedback.

4074BFF29BBC49109D7C6E802073DF8B.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the core concepts of technology.--The student will be able to:

7A6FD5ADB61E4690A6F29A975DE53DFD.description: (Explain, Demonstrate) how corporations can often create demand for a product by bringing it onto the market and advertising it.

D0AFC77E44B0465D91916FA88103EC93.description: Explain how technology is closely linked with creativity, which has resulted in innovation.

E28362791E874BE9855C4F925D34242E.description: Describe the development of technology as a human activity that is the result of individual or collective needs and the ability to be creative.

F9D7D176144B4D2EA618F2406261F3D6.description: Develop new products and systems to solve problems or to help do things that could not be done without the help of technology.

732E3D7C28554459801DBB7258CE2F4D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the characteristics and scope of technology.--The student will be able to:
